> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On 

> >  part=
ial failures of setUp are not handled properly (and they will 
> > flag all=
 the tests as "FAILURES", which is incorrect:  the  tests were 
> > simply =
not run and the error is in setUp(), not in the test 
> methods).
> 
> So w=
e wrap setup()'s content in a try block?

That's not going to help:

- Eith=
er setUp() succeeds and all your tests are run (and in this case, they
will=
 fail)
- Or setUp() fails and JUnit still invokes your tests anyway (and th=
ey will
fail)

This is why I introduced a third status in TestNG: "SKIPPED"=
.

If a setUp() method or a test method you depend on fails, then the tests=

will not be run and marked SKIPPED, so you don't waste time investigating
=
them.

--
